newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia Independent coy on Telstra vote.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia Independent coy on Telstra vote.

text.p: Key Australian Independent senator Brian Harradine refused on Wednesday to rule out voting for the Australian Government's proposed partial sale of telecommunications carrier Telstra Corp.
Asked by reporters whether he would vote for the sale if the government rejected his alternative proposal, Harradine said: "Well, let me wait until I get the official response from the government."
"I don't believe in writing to people and hearing the answer other than in a considered response in writing and that's what I'm waiting for," he said.
Treasurer Peter Costello said earlier on Wednesday that Harradine's proposal to issue redeemable preference shares in Telstra held no attraction for the government.
However, Harradine said he did not believe Costello was referring to his proposal, but rather was speaking more generally.

"The treasurer of this country is entitled to say what he likes and to say it in the general terms that he did and I didn't hear him say categorically that the government was not going to accept the proposal that I've put forward," he said.
